tweet: Last week, I rose on the House floor to honor the life of Barbara Keller: a dear friend and inspiring local leader who lived to serve others. Her memory lives on in the hearts of the countless individuals whose lives she touched. pic.twitter.com/dBkTPCL9Nc

I cosponsored legislation to protect our friends, families, and neighbors who work in high heat environments from heatstroke and exhaustion by establishing safe working conditions and training employers on how to respond to the symptoms of heat illnesses!

Thank you to the firefighters, engineers, and local and state officials who joined me this week to see how far our mountain communities have come in their recovery from the Valentine’s Day flood. Idyllwild is open for business! pic.twitter.com/qLDQX94xFE

This article makes clear that politically-motivated government shutdowns take a toll on our communities. My office helped Charles – a veteran from Cathedral City – get the care from the VA he needed to correct his vision and maintain his independence. If you or a veteran in your life needs help navigating the VA, contact my office at 760-424-8888. We're here to help!
This week, I voted for the PAST Act to end the practice of horse soring once and for all. Cruelty to horses has no place in our nation!

This week, I voted for the Autism CARES Act to support autism research, education, and early detection. Thank you to the hundreds of local community members who contacted my office in support of this critically important bill!

#ICYMI – this week, I held a roundtable bringing together our local and state officials to ensure we are prepared for the next earthquake, wildfire, flood, or other natural disaster. It’s critical that we work together to keep local communities safe and informed. pic.twitter.com/o6jRz1J1I5

We’ve all been victim to annoying and unwanted robocalls. It’s time to protect our communities from illegal scams and spam calls. This week, I voted for the #StopBadRobocalls Act on the House floor to protect seniors and families from these dangerous scammers. pic.twitter.com/r02OXC0f9P

One year after the Cranston Fire, our communities are continuing to rebuild and recover. I’m fighting for the federal resources our communities need. Let’s support our neighbors by visiting Idyllwild and the mountain communities this summer! https://www.desertsun.com/story/news/environment/2019/07/25/idyllwild-california-remembers-cranston-wildfire-one-year-later/1715729001/ …

We must provide our veterans with the support, resources, and benefits they have earned and deserved. This week, I supported legislation to expand federal grants to help disabled veterans in our local communities adapt their homes to meet their mobility needs.

One of the best parts of being your advocate and representative is helping you cut through the red tape to get the resources and support you've earned. If you're having trouble navigating a federal agency, give my office a call at (760) 424-8888! pic.twitter.com/5LShnopW94

In the United States of America, when children die on our watch, we take action.

When children are dying, we must act. 

The House just passed my Humanitarian Standards for Individuals In CBP Custody Act, to meet the humanitarian needs of children and families at the border. https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1eaKbvnDZrkKX …

Tonight, I'm voting to support the Manufacturing USA program, which will help cement the U.S. as a global leader in manufacturing technology. This program brings together government, educators, and businesses to grow high-paying jobs in our local communities and across the U.S.

My office recently helped Amber from Hemet cut through the red tape at the VA and finally receive the benefits she earned and deserved. If you need help navigating the VA or another federal agency, give us a call at (760) 424-8888.
I'm so glad that I could see the Pendleton family from Beaumont in DC this week! Thanks for making the trip to our nation’s capital. pic.twitter.com/Cg9srwccDZ

The Salton Sea is a danger to the health of our communities, and we must act to prevent our children and seniors from developing respiratory illnesses. I recently met with @UCRiverside to discuss how we can turn our policies into action and end this public health crisis. pic.twitter.com/BC8MlsjEkJ
That's why yesterday, I voted to pass the Intelligence Authorization Act, and why I'm working to bring high-paying cybersecurity jobs back home!

The cost of damage related to cybercrime is expected to reach $6 trillion per year by 2021. We must strengthen our intelligence cybersecurity workforce at the national and local levels to address this threat.

I've heard from many of my constituents who are fed up with unwanted & disruptive robocalls. That's why I cosponsored the #StopBadRobocalls Act, which passed @EnergyCommerce this week. This bill puts consumers in control of their phones! https://nbcpalmsprings.com/2019/07/15/pspd-warns-of-robocallers-targeting-locals/ …

For too many families, receiving a surprise medical bill from an out-of-network provider is devastating. That's why yesterday, @EnergyCommerce passed the No Surprises Act, a bill that includes my amendment creating a fair process to keep patients off the hook for #surprisebills. pic.twitter.com/nC3b5prEYj

This week, I voted for the National Defense Authorization Act to give our servicemembers a much needed raise, upgrade housing for military families, and clean contaminated drinking water threatening their health. I urge the Senate to pass this important bill!

Today, the House passed my amendments to help end the use of #burnpits, educate doctors about the health effects of burn pit exposure, and increase transparency about active burn pits threatening the health of servicemembers stationed overseas. pic.twitter.com/3HIFkGdSzg
This week, I introduced three bills that will help make sure our elected officials are working to serve the people – not to enrich themselves. pic.twitter.com/eDTr58rfME

My office recently helped Marilyn – a senior citizen from Palm Desert – get her tax refund less than a month after she contacted my office. If you’re having an issue with the IRS or any federal agency, call my office at 760-424-8888. We’re here to serve you!

As Jennifer once said to me at her kitchen table, burn pits are the Agent Orange of our generation. We can't wait to protect our servicemembers and ensure our veterans can get the health care and benefits they have earned and deserve.

That's why I have introduced legislation to end the use of burn pits once and for all, educate veterans and doctors about warning signs and symptoms of related illnesses, and increase transparency around our military's use of burn pits today.

Veterans like Jennifer Kepner -- a mother of two from Cathedral City -- have lost their lives battling illnesses linked to their exposure to toxic burn pits: fields where our military has burned everything from batteries to jet fuel. This must end.

Lt. Col. Robert Friend was a pioneer and a pilot who served our country bravely during World War II as a member of the Tuskegee Airmen. Protecting our democracy means protecting the security of our elections. That's why last week, I voted to pass the Securing America’s Federal Elections Act to strengthen our election infrastructure & ensure voters—not foreign governments—are in the driver’s seat of our democracy.

So glad that I was able to meet with Kelly, a local librarian in Beaumont, before her family's Capitol Hill tour. When I'm home, I love stopping by our local libraries to pick up a new book. Thank you for visiting DC this week, Kelly! It was a pleasure meeting you. pic.twitter.com/8hpn5NY602

Together, we can overcome the stigma of mental illness and protect the men and women who keep us safe. https://www.desertsun.com/story/news/politics/2019/07/01/congress-raul-ruiz-california-earmarks-mental-health-funding-law-enforcement/1589946001/ …

Many law enforcement officers struggle in silence with PTSD, anxiety, and depression without access to the mental health resources they need. Thank you to our local law enforcement leaders for inspiring my amendment to support programs that can help.
